intro: Heteropterys trichanthera var. cuyabensis, commonly known as the Cuyabeno hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon Basin. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant has palmate leaves with a rough, hairy texture, and it thrives in moist, tropical environments. It is often found in swampy areas and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in local ecosystems. Its ornamental value makes it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists.
